text: Roland Phleps (1924 − 20 April 2020) was a German sculptor. ==Biography== Phleps was born in the Sibiu (German: Hermannstadt), Romania. After World War II, in which he served as a soldier, he studied medicine at the universities of Tübingen and Göttingen in Germany. He obtained his doctorate in Tübingen and was a physician assistant in hospitals in Tübingen, Lübeck, Esslingen am Neckar and Freiburg from 1951 to 1959. In 1959 he lived as a neurologist- psychologist in Freiburg. From the early 1980s he was interested in the art movement Konkrete Kunst. Between 1983 and 1984 he experimented with geometric constructions of aluminum plates. From 1992 he started exhibiting his work, and his work was placed at public places. From that period he made his works in stainless steel. The artist lived, worked and died in April 2020 in Freiburg im Breisgau. ==Stiftung Konkrete Kunst== In 1997 Phleps founded the Stiftung Konkrete Kunst Roland Phleps and in 1999 the Skulpturenhalle opened in Freiburg, where the work of Phleps is exhibited. Exhibitions are also organized, in which the following artists, among others, have participated: * Andreu Alfaro (2005) * Hans Dieter Bohnet (2006) * Erich Hauser (2005) * Gottfried Honegger (2010) * Heinz Mack (2000 and 2004) * Marcello Morandini (2001 and 2004) == Work at public places (selection) == * Terpsichore, Loretto Krankenhaus in Freiburg and Technische Universität in Dresden * Windspiel, Stadtgarten in Freiburg * Gestänge im Raum (Ordnung und Chaos), Universitätsklinikum in Dresden * Dipylon (1997), Botanischer Garten in Freiburg * Tripylon, Klinikum der Universität in Freiburg' * Großer Schwung, Mensa Universität Freiburg * Pas de Deux, Technische Universität in Dresden * Ikarus en andere sculpturen, Skulpturenwiese am Waltersberg in Freiburg * Alpha I en Alpha II, Kunstlandschaft Donau in Ulm * Windspiel (2000), Stadtgarten in Freiburg * Adelphoi 3 (2005), Kulturspeicher Würzburg * Anthos (2006), Kurpark in Badenweiler * Bündel-Stele 1 (2007), Platz der Universität in Freiburg and Bündel-Stele 2 VIRIBUS UNIBUS (2008) at the Transilvania Halle in Sibiu == Gallary == File:Freiburg_Phleps_201.jpg|Bündel-Stele 1, University of Freiburg File:Freiburg Phleps 021.jpg|Skulpturenwiese Freiburg File:Freiburg Phleps 007.jpg|Skulpturenwiese Freiburg File:Freiburg Phleps 024.jpg|Skulpturenwiese Freiburg File:Freiburg Phleps 017.jpg|Skulpturenwiese Freiburg File:Freiburg Phleps 129.jpg|Dipylon (1997), Botanischer Garten File:Freiburg Phleps 005-11.jpg|Windspiel (2000), Stadtgarten ==References== ==External links== * Porträt Roland Phleps (pdf) Category:1924 births Category:Date of birth missing Category:2020 deaths Category:German sculptors Category:People from Freiburg im Breisgau
